citeinfo.origin: WorldPop (School of Geography and Environmental Science, University of Southampton).
citeinfo.title: Bottom-up gridded population estimates for Zambia, version 1.0.

pubinfo.publish: WorldPop Research Group, University of Southampton.

descript.abstract: This geotiff raster contains estimates of total population size for each approximately 100m grid cell (0.0008333 decimal degrees grid) across Zambia. The values are the mean of the posterior probability distribution for the predicted population size in each grid cell. NA values represent areas that were mapped as unsettled according to building footprints data (Building Footprints Zambia, Digitize Africa data © 2020 Maxar Technologies, Ecopia.AI)
descript.purpose: To aid uses, applications and field work that would benefit from having population data at a high spatial resolution that is restricted to settled areas.

theme.themekey: gridded population estimates, demographics, gis, bayesian statistics
Human population, Sub-national, Spatial dataset, Bayesian statistics

idinfo.accconst: These data may not be shared or distributed outside of the GRID3 partners/donors and the Zambian Government. Contact release@worldpop.org for more information.

cntorgp.cntorg: WorldPop Research Group, University of Southampton

idinfo.datacred:
These population estimates were produced by the WorldPop Research Group at the University of Southampton. This work was part of the GRID3 project with funding from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (BMGF) and the United Kingdom’s Department for International Development (OPP1182408). Project partners included the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA), Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN) in the Earth Institute at Columbia University, and the Flowminder Foundation. .
Contact release@worldpop.org for more information.
